title: Literary Argument - suffering and tragic figure

content.description:
According to critic Northrop Frye, “Tragic heroes are so much the highest points in their human landscape that they seem the inevitable conductors of the power about them, great trees more likely to be struck by lightning than a clump of grass. Conductors may of course be instruments as well as victims of the divine lightning.”

Either from your own reading or from the list below, choose a work of fiction in which a tragic figure functions as an instrument of the suffering of others. Then, in a well-written essay, analyze how the suffering brought upon others by that figure contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole.

In your response you should do the following:

Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents a defensible interpretation.

Provide evidence to support your line of reasoning.

Explain how the evidence supports your line of reasoning.

Use appropriate grammar and punctuation in communicating your argument.
